subtitles.dialogue_text: Studio Ghibli, Nippon Television Network, Dentsu, Hakuhodo DYMP, Walt Disney Japan, Mitsubishi, Toho and KDDI presents
In this world, there is an invisible magic circle.
So you did go out with him. What?
Oh, I'm so glad. Thank you, Doctor.
Anna, do you feel all right now?
You looked like you were in agony.
I brought Anna's bag. Her notebook is inside.
We were just nearby. If there is anything else...
Has Anna been getting along with you?
She tells me nothing about school.
She is probably a hermit at school.
It's true that stress can trigger asthma.
Meanwhile, my husband is off on a business trip.
Maybe he and I are partly to blame too.
Have you noticed anything about her?
Like she won't show her emotions...
She used to be more expressive.
But these days, I don't even know...
Maybe it's as if she weren't my daughter.
You may want to send her somewhere to get better.
Do you remember Uncle and Aunt Oiwa?
The air is very clean where they live.
It'll help your condition to spend some time there.
I can't go with you but they'll take care of you.
Be a good girl, eat well...
and come back nice and happy.
No, but Auntie told me all about you.
I hope I'm not much trouble. Thank you for having me.
Get on in. Sorry it's a bit of a clunker.
This area has changed since I was last here. All these new shops.
Where we're headed is a nice, relaxing place.
But since the highway was built, people stopped coming.
They still haven't fixed that pothole!
The wind here will fix you up in no time.
Nice place? Bet you'd like Auntie to see it too.
Oh, that's a silo. It's for storing feed for livestock.
Hasn't been used in decades, though.
Now the village kids use it for dares.
They say there are ghosts there.
Best to stay away from there.
Look, that's our house over there.
It's too much for us to eat.
He is always accepting gifts without thinking...
Our kids are all grown up and moved out.
You must think it's an odd house.
It'd be sad to clear everything, so I left it as it was.
She is a yoga teacher in Tokyo now.
I'm thinking of trying it myself.
And feel free to use the closet and shelves.
'Write me how things are, whatever you please. Yoriko'
Postcards, how quaint! You should write her.
Seems a little stuffy in here.
Mr. and Mrs.Oiwa are both very kind.
I'm going to mail this in.
Okay, I'll save it for dessert.
By the way, there is a shortcut by the parking lot.
Wait, I need to drop off a letter.
I wonder if anyone lives here.
I guess there is no one here.
He is a bear. Or maybe a sea lion.
Completely different in high tide, isn't it?
It's the power of the moon.
But imagine that, Toichi giving a girl a ride on his boat.
He is actually a good guy. Just not much of a talker.
You should ask him for a ride again.
But it's best you stay away from "The Marsh House".
Looked like no one lives there.
Used to be a vacation home for some foreigners.
Then it changed hands a few times.
But it's been vacant for a while now.
Yoriko was worried about her, but she looks fine to me.
As long as she is having fun and eating well.
All the trash you pick up will be collected here.
Toichi who only talks once a decade!
Hey, I said we're not going there until later.
Perhaps we'll hear from you next time.
I have a little errand, so hold on.
He should be delivering these himself.
"I'm allergic to that lady" he says.
But Mrs.Kadoya is been wanting to meet you.
Their daughter Nobuko is a year older than you.
Nobuko is at cram school today.
This must be Anna. Nice to meet you.
You should go to the Tanabata Festival with Nobuko tomorrow.
Great idea! I should still have my daughter's yukata.
You can wear it to the festival.
I'll let Nobuko know. Now come in.
I won't look good in it.
I wish I was wearing a yukata too.
Mom says I should wear those. It's not fair.
So Anna, where are you from?
Cool, I bet the city has great shopping.
Maybe lots of cute boys too?
Not much to choose from here in the countryside.
He is always making the same mistakes.
There it is. Will my wish come true?
Hey, where were you? I was looking for you.
"I wish for a normal life everyday"
Anna, what do you mean by normal?
It's a bit blue, like a foreign...
I see what you mean by normal.
But there is no use pretending to be normal.
After all, you look like just what you are.
We don't have long to live. Typically, you're the ones who...
We're not blaming you. It's just that...
I've already told you. It's not about money.
I feel bad for her, but...
It'll be best for her if you two...
You look like the girl I saw in my dreams.
I would like to get to know you.
I just got here. How long have you been here?
Look at this, the marsh at night.
How beautiful. Say, let's go down for a closer look.
By the way, where is that child?
Was she not in her room?
Usually I'm in bed by this hour.
Come on, I'll row you back.
Yes, I left it for you on purpose.
But I thought you'd row a little better.
I haven't told anyone about you and I won't.
If someone finds out, they'll only spoil it.
It was teary. She came home crying.
And she pulled out a cutter too. The horror!
No, you need to hear it from the girl herself.
Seems she is not home yet.
She is out of place, out and about this late!
You two should look into that.
Better keep an eye on her.
What if something happens to one of the kids?
So what if she is a bit late?
She is not out of place.
Were you listening? Don't you worry.
You two will get along just fine.
Now take a bath and have dinner.
Thank you. Or is it dinner before the bath?
But names is a bit harsh.
Hop in. Time for a picnic.
That's right. Let's go across the marsh.
Remember I said last night that you're my precious secret?
I remember. And you're my secret.
But I don't even know your name yet.
There is so much I want to know about you.
But I want to find out slowly.
Slowly by myself, as we go along.
I'll tell you what we'll do.
We'll ask each other three questions a night.
Question one: Why are you here in this village?
The doctor said I should go somewhere with clean air for a while.
If there is no attack, I'm fine.
So I'm staying here with Auntie's relatives, the Oiwas.
It's my turn to ask now.
Do you live in that mansion?
They only come here sometimes. They're busy with work.
But I was a worry to her, so she sent me here for a while.
I'll explain that some other time.
Just curious what it's like to have siblings.
I know, it'd be fun to imagine that.
What's it like living at the Oiwas?
There you are. I wondered where you went.
I looked all over for you. You just disappeared.
I was just trying to answer your question.
I need to go soon. Today is...
No, no, I really can't! Parties aren't really my...
Sorry, did you wait long? I had trouble getting away.
I borrowed Nan's shawl. I'll be scolded again.
Don't worry, I spoke to Father.
I believe it is past your bedtime.
You must be up to no good again.
Let's go. If you keep this up,
you'll grow up to be childish always!
Everyone, we have a lovely flower girl here.
There is Marnie. She'll be pretty like her mother.
May I please have one of those flowers?
That woman there is the real witch.
I want only one, for good luck.
Will someone kindly pay for my flower?
If it is the witch's command...
You mean Kazuhiko? An old friend.
Now let's dance, you and I.
It's the girl with the Oiwas.
I see. Hope you find the other shoe.
There is a bunch buried in the mud flats.
I should have my daughter's old shoes.
Not only are they big, they're delicious, too.
Auntie teaches me all the time.
My daughter could learn from you.
I remember when you first came to Yoriko's place.
She wanted to make up for the five years she didn't have with you.
So she taught you things, like knife skills.
When I told her I was busy, she started complaining.
I shouldn't share this about your mother.
You know, Yoriko sent us tons of photos of you.
Found the wind chime I made on our honeymoon.
Shall I give you a haircut?
How could I nearly forget about Marnie?
That girl looks like someone I knew.
But I haven't seen her in a week.
I wonder if she is upset that I forgot.
If she is a friend, talk to her and you'll be fine.
Say, will you take a look?
I'm in love with "The Marsh House". What about you?
I'm Anna. I love it too.
Better hurry and finish your drawing...
before the new folks move in.
Thanks for your hard work. Have some tea.
I hadn't seen the front before.
It's a lot cleaner now, but not done yet.
A guest? Yeah, a secret one.
Yes, we're still in the middle of renovation.
It used to be your room, right?
But...then why have you been staring at my room?
Because... See, that's where I always see you.
I just love this mansion, that's all.
When I said Marnie earlier, you were surprised.
Rather, why do you know Marnie?
I found it behind the shelf.
I'll pour you some Queen Mary, your favorite.
"Last night I went for a row in my nightie.
The marsh and the moon were very pretty at night"
Father, Mother and many of their friends came. It was such fun.
I went outside from the sunroom
and danced with a flower girl.
Nan locked me in my room because of last night.
So there won't be any midnight rows for a bit.
An imaginary girl, only in my mind.
It's as if she really lived here.
I thought you were Marnie, back for her diary...
I'm Anna. I came from Sapporo to get better.
But if she was imaginary, why is her name the same?
Marnie must be real. I'm going to investigate.
Wait, that one is not done yet...
I've never had anyone draw me before. How nice!
I kept calling you in my heart.
Let's go. Come to my room.
I can't go far from the mansion.
Okay then, we'll go wherever you want.
You know a lot about mushrooms.
Father taught me when I was little.
I once brought home three bags full of mushrooms.
What's wrong? So quiet all of a sudden.
My real parents died when I was little.
I know they didn't die on purpose, but...
You're lucky to be a single child.
then the folks who took you in as a daughter
Then I'll tell you a big secret.
It's about my parents. They're good to me and they're kind.
I'm not their real child, yet they raised me, which I appreciate.
But you see, I saw it one day.
I found a letter from the government.
It said they were increasing the subsidy for me.
I'm sure there is a reason...
They wouldn't get it if I were their real child.
They get paid because I'm not their real child.
Even worse... they hide it from me.
But that doesn't mean Auntie doesn't love you.
None of the other families receive money. Just us!
She always looks worried that I might find out.
And I hate myself for thinking like this.
Just know that I love you.
I love you more than any girl I've ever known.
Then you tell me your secret next.
It was long ago that I went mushrooming with Father.
Nowadays, I hardly see my parents.
Because of work, Father is home only twice a year.
Usually, Nan and the twin maids are the only ones home.
I slip out while they're gossiping.
And look how free I get to be.
It's lovely when my parents come home.
and many people there, it's delightful.
I get to wear new dresses and dance too.
That's when I'm sure I'm the luckiest girl in the world.
Tell me, Anna. Will you be my friend forever?
Nan is always in a bad mood.
She yanks me by the arm, brushes my hair very hard.
No one thinks I'm being bullied.
The maids love to frighten me.
They threatened me all the time.
"Naughty kids get shut in the silo
where ghosts suck out their soul'' they said.
You mean, the silo on the hill?
Once, they actually took me there.
They dragged me all the way to the silo.
I thought I'd die of fright.
just as we got there, the sky went dark and the thunder came.
The maids were terrified, so we didn't go inside.
I never heard such a terrible thing.
I hope the maids and Nan get struck by lightning.
Hasn't anyone ever tried to frighten you?
Funny, it's like we traded places.
Hey, let's go to the silo together.
The ghosts must be a lie. Let's go make sure.
Tomorrow... No, let's go right now.
I don't care who Marnie really is.
I just want to help her.
Yes, I'm sure I'll be all right if I'm with you...
The rest of the diary. Come to my place.
What? But it's a major discovery...
So you did go ahead. Don't scare me like that.
Are you okay? Why did you...
I'm frightened. I heard somebody below.
I thought I'd die of fright. Kazuhiko...
What are you saying? I'm Anna. Pull yourself together.
I don't want to be humiliated.
You do have courage. You came here.
It's just the wind. Let's go.
We made it up. I'm sure we can make it down.
I'll go first, so follow me.
Don't worry, we'll be fine if we're together.
Kazuhiko is all over this diary.
"Kazuhiko is trying to take me to the silo"
Why go out on a night like this?
My friend might be caught in the rain. What if she gets pneumonia?
Her fever is not coming down.
She did get a shot earlier.
Leaving me behind without a word.
Marnie! How could you leave me behind?
I'm sorry, I didn't mean to leave you all alone.
But at that moment, you weren't there.
I can't stay here any longer.
I have to say goodbye to you.
So please, Anna, please say you forgive me.
You could see her in your room.
The view here is beautiful. I'd love to show you. Anna
This is what made me think you might be at the silo.
The rest of the diary you promised to read.
I found a clue in this painting that was behind the cupboard.
Please, will you tell us about Marnie?
It was a long time ago.
I used to play at The Marsh House often.
Marnie and I were very little.
It's a bear! Let me see.
This is Daddy. Isn't he dashing?
her glamorous parents and their extravagant parties.
But the truth is, she could have been cared for more.
No, don't leave me, Mommy! Don't go!
Seems the maids didn't look after her very well.
and married Kazuhiko, her childhood friend.
With her family apart and feeling lost...
he was there to support her.
I'm glad. So Kazuhiko was a good man.
Two years later, Emily was born.
At last in the warm household she'd always wanted, Marnie was happy.
I didn't see Marnie for many years after that.
a few years after Kazuhiko had passed on of an illness.
Marnie was in a sanatorium due to the shock.
A place where you go to get better.
Marnie's parents had passed on, leaving no one to look after her.
So for elementary school, she was sent to a boarding school.
By the time she returned at age 17, she'd become a different person.
but still resented her for sending her away.
You think that makes you more motherly?
I want you to live the way you wish, but...
They never did make up after that.
I've never thought of you as a mother.
Emily ran away and soon got married.
One day, Emily and her husband got into a car accident.
I heard Marnie took their child in.
She was determined to never let this child be lonely.
she never got over losing Emily.
She became very ill, and passed on the next year.
That was about ten years ago.
I'm sorry, it's a sad story.
She loved seeing the marsh from her window.
She said it felt like the birds spoke to her.
Always with a smile, determined to be happy.
Wish we could've played more, Anna.
The plan was always just for the summer.
Will you come again next summer?
I'm sure I will. I'll write you.
I put the diary and painting back where I found them.
The girl trapped behind the blue window...
Exactly, he does it to save her life.
Ah, now I want to read it all over again.
She is doing well and even made a friend.
How can I ever repay you?
Oh, no. We didn't do anything at all.
It was like having our own daughter back.
I'm impressed you didn't call us this time.
There is something I need to tell you.
We receive monthly monies to cover your expenses.
I've long hesitated to tell you, but...
Whether or not we receive monies,
it doesn't change our love for you.
I'm happy you told me about it.
I've been looking at the photos you sent.
While you were away I was looking at old albums
When you first came, you wouldn't let it go.
I was told at the adoption
And so I was in the silo all night.
He encouraged me, saying I did well.
you're my one and only grandchild.
I'm sorry for what I said.
Don't skip trash pickup next year.
I'm going home to Sapporo now.
But your face tells me something good happened.
Thank you for being kind to Anna.
I'll write you. I have some amazing news.
Susumu Terajima, Toshie Negishi, Ryoko Moriyama, Kazuko Yoshiyuki
Based on the novel 'When Marnie Was There' by Joan G. Robinson
Screenplay: Keiko Niwa, Masashi Ando and Hiromasa Yonebayashi
Music: Takatsugu Muramatsu Theme Song: Priscilla Ahn
